Message.Msg: Bad Grammar! Why would anyone pay attention to what you write?
Romney will win easily despite the polls. Could end up with over 300 electoral votes. Romney's internal polls indicate landslide.

Message.Title: Still looking for an Entry Point
Message.Msg: I got out just under $198 on 10/18. I've been following the daily price movements like a hawk because I want to own IBM for the long term. Yesterday and the day before I shorted IBM when it was up around $3 for the day and closed out both trades for 1.7 points profit in total for both trades. I didn't do that today when it was up because I didn't have a clue what would happen. My choice for President is Romney but I'm not sure a Romney win will be good for the market per se because Gov't spending will be headed down, and there will be a much smaller chance that the numerous municipalities that can't fund pensions will be bailed out. A Romney Administration may also focus on how the Fed will wind down the funding of the American mortgage market etc. and transfer it to private American financial institutions -- in a manner like the old American mortgage backed security markets developed in the late 70's and 80's which produced truly investment grade securities. The shift to the private sector driving the economy in lieu of the Fed may deflate stocks -- don't know for sure of course -- but I'm worried about the stock market thru the election.

Topic.Title: Still looking for an Entry Point

Message.Msg: Mr_dinky, There is technical damage on the IBM chart. The stock has heavy resistance at $200! The markets are correcting, and nobody should be in a hurry to be long stocks until the markets start a new uptrend. I am not worried about the price as I just hold the stock because it will all be given to my kids eventually.

Romney compares Sandy clean up to a footbal field clean up after a game where trashes are thrown in few places. Doe he know that people lost their family, friends and homes and whatever they had and some people are in need of water, food and shelter right now? IBM is #1 defensive stock. Your money is secure and it will gain eventually one way or another. IBM will pay you dividend ($.85 /share) if you can hold your shares by next Thrusday.

Message.Title: Dumb and Dumber
Message.Msg: 1. A failure in Afghanistan (Bush, a continuing success in Iraq) 2. A failure in Libya 3. A failure to investigate B. Frank and C. Dodd as root cause of financial meltdown 4. A failure in Fast-and-Furious 5. A failure in green energy investments 6. A failure to enact any Simpson-Bowles recommendations 7. A failure in most 2008 campaign promises (Gitmo, transparency, ... But, what did you expect from a former ACORN community activist with no governing or business experience. The perfect storm of 2008. Hillary should have been the choice. And then there's Biden... jeesh, enough said.

Message.Title: Below $192 next week
Message.Msg: Monday it will have a big drop again. Will see alike at $18X.XX

Yeah, but Romney's LBO practice destroyed jobs and leveraged companies into bankruptcy while he off-shored ill-gotten cash to avoid paying US taxes. Some patriot. And his Bain Capital took decent paying jobs and sent them to China for 30 pieces of silver. What a fantastic businessman HE is. A Romney victory will be a win for GREED and the upper 1%. But he's a good salesman and you're buying the snake oil . . .
